lom:description.lom:string: Sample exercises and lesson plans from the Exploratorium Museum's science-at-home books. It site shows entertaining activities that use simple ingredients and are accompanied by helpful information for explaining underlying scientific concepts. The illustrated examples incude geodesic gum drops (making amazing architecture with candy and toothpicks), Go with the Flow (spin the bottle to see beautiful swirling shapes), making a volcano (make your own miniature 'lava lite'), experiments with light, growing crystals (grow spikes of crystals in the sun), sunclocks, rainbows, and many more. Each activity comes with full instructions and a materials list.

lom:title.lom:string: The Science Explorer - An Exploratorium-At-Home Book
